snippet.title: Aung San Suu Kyi's 'silence' on the Rohingya: Has 'The Lady' lost her voice?
snippet.description:
* Having endured nearly 15 years of house arrest with grace and courage, Aung San Suu Kyi has earned a reputation throughout the world as a political superstar of rare moral stature.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/15/world/asia/myanmar-aung-san-suu-kyi-rohingya-disappointment/index.html

snippet.title: Concern as Buddhist mobs target foreign aid groups in Myanmar
snippet.description:
* The United States has expressed "deep concern" about mob violence reportedly targeting international NGOs operating in Myanmar's restive west.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/28/world/asia/myanmar-rakhine-ngos-violence/index.html

snippet.title: Journalists charged over human trafficking report are released on bail
snippet.description:
* Two journalists in Thailand have been released on bail in a controversial defamation case that has raised concerns over press freedom in the country.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/18/world/asia/thailand-phuketwan-bail/index.html

snippet.title: How strategic is Sri Lanka?
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Scientists race to eliminate malaria as 'wonder drug' loses its powers
snippet.description: * The meandering Moei river marks the natural boundary between Thailand and Myanmar. Its muddy waters are at their fullest, but Francois Nosten still crosses them in just a minute, aboard a narrow, wooden boat. In the dry season, he could wade across. As he steps onto the western riverbank, in Myanmar http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/25/health/scientists-eliminate-malaria/index.html

snippet.title: U.N. condemns Thai court case against journalists over people trafficking report
snippet.description:
* A criminal defamation case against two journalists in Thailand is set to proceed this week, despite calls from the United Nations and prominent rights groups for the charges to be dropped amid concerns over press freedom there.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/14/world/asia/thailand-phuketwan-media-defamation-court/index.html

snippet.title: Fears Rakhine extremists could drive more aid agencies out of Myanmar state
snippet.description:
* The expulsion of an international medical NGO providing a vital lifeline to displaced Muslims in Myanmar's Rakhine state has raised fears other aid agencies could be next.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/04/world/asia/myanmar-rohingya-msf-fears/index.html

snippet.title: Medecins Sans Frontieres banned in Myanmar state for alleged 'Rohingya bias'
snippet.description:
* Medecins Sans Frontieres has been banned from operating in Myanmar's strife-torn Rakhine State, following official accusations the aid organization is biased towards the state's persecuted Rohingya minority.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/03/world/asia/myanmar-rakhine-doctors-without-borders/index.html

snippet.title: Despite reforms, Myanmar's ethnic violence continues
snippet.description:
* When the European Union recently lifted economic sanctions on Myanmar, it closed a decades-long chapter designed to encourage democratic reform in the country.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/06/opinion/myanmar-smith-rohingya-muslims/index.html
